intro: Stypandra umbellata var. fraseri, commonly known as the Fraser's stypandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive umbellate inflorescence, which consists of small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough, hairy texture, while the flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color. This variety is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance.
